bosk.executor.base#

Module Contents#

Classes#

BaseSlotHandler

Determines slots' handling policy: checks whether a slot is required for the stage.

DefaultSlotHandler

Default slot handling policy.

ExecutionResult

Pipeline execution result. Basically behaves as a dictionary of BaseData objects.

BaseExecutor

Base pipeline executor.
class bosk.executor.base.BaseSlotHandler#

Bases: abc.ABC

Determines slots’ handling policy: checks whether a slot is required for the stage.

abstract is_slot_required(stage, slot)#

Method that determines if the slot is required during the computational graph execution.

Parameters:

  • stage (bosk.stages.Stage) – The execution stage.

  • slot (bosk.block.base.BlockInputSlot) – The computational block’s slot to check.

Return type:

bool

class bosk.executor.base.DefaultSlotHandler#

Bases: BaseSlotHandler

Default slot handling policy.

At FIT stage requires preceding block execution even if it will be required only for transforming data.

At TRANSFORM stage requires preceding block execution only if it is needed for the given input slot.

is_slot_required(stage, slot)#

Method that determines if the slot is required during the computational graph execution.

Parameters:

  • stage (bosk.stages.Stage) – The execution stage.

  • slot (bosk.block.base.BlockInputSlot) – The computational block’s slot to check.

Return type:

bool

class bosk.executor.base.ExecutionResult(result)#

Bases: Dict[str, bosk.data.BaseData]

Pipeline execution result. Basically behaves as a dictionary of BaseData objects.

Wraps a dictionary of BaseData objects and provides method to obtain dictionary of NumPy arrays. Rationale: frequently expected result of the pipeline execution is a dictionary of NumPy arrays.

Parameters:

result (Dict[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) –

numpy()#

Convert execution result to dictionary of NumPy arrays.

Returns:

Dictionary of NumPy arrays.

Return type:

Dict[str, numpy.ndarray]

class bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor(pipeline, stage, inputs=None, outputs=None, slot_handler=None, block_executor=None)#

Bases: abc.ABC

Base pipeline executor.

Note, that all properties are stored as fields with “__” predix, for example pipeline property corresponds to the underlying field __pipeline. This allows a derived class to override property getter, preserving the original field, probably used internally by the framework.

pipeline#

The pipeline (computational graph). Contains blocks as nodes and connections between output and input blocks’ slots as edges.

Return type:

bosk.pipeline.BasePipeline

stage#

The computational mode, which will be performed by the executor.

Return type:

bosk.stages.Stage

slot_handler#

Object defining the executor’s behaviour during slots processing.

Return type:

BaseSlotHandler

block_executor#

Object defining the executor’s behaviour during blocks processing.

Return type:

bosk.executor.block.BaseBlockExecutor

inputs#

Set of the inputs to process. Passing it, you set up the hard requirement for the input values to execute the computational graph. Keep it None to use any of the pipeline’s inputs during the execution process.

Return type:

Optional[FrozenSet[str]]

outputs#

Set of the outputs to process. Keep it None to handle all of the pipeline’s outputs.

Return type:

Optional[FrozenSet[str]]

Parameters:

  • pipeline (bosk.pipeline.BasePipeline) – Sets pipeline.

  • stage (bosk.stages.Stage) – Sets stage.

  • inputs (Optional[Sequence[str]]) – Sets inputs.

  • outputs (Optional[Sequence[str]]) – Sets outputs.

  • slot_handler (Optional[BaseSlotHandler]) – Sets slot_handler with _prepare_slot_handler method.

  • block_executor (Optional[bosk.executor.block.BaseBlockExecutor]) – Sets block_executor with _prepare_block_executor method.

Raises:

  • AssertionError – If it was unable to find some input in the pipeline.

  • AssertionError – If it was unable to find some output in the pipeline.

property pipeline: bosk.pipeline.BasePipeline#

Getter for the executor’s pipeline.

Return type:

bosk.pipeline.BasePipeline

property inputs: Optional[FrozenSet[str]]#

Getter for the executor’s inputs set. None if there are no restrictions on the pipeline’s inputs.

Return type:

Optional[FrozenSet[str]]

property outputs: Optional[FrozenSet[str]]#

Getter for the executor’s ouputs set. None if there are no restrictions on the pipeline’s outputs.

Return type:

Optional[FrozenSet[str]]

property slot_handler: BaseSlotHandler#

Getter for the executor’s slots handler.

Return type:

BaseSlotHandler

property block_executor: bosk.executor.block.BaseBlockExecutor#

Getter for the executor’s block executor.

Return type:

bosk.executor.block.BaseBlockExecutor

property stage: bosk.stages.Stage#

Getter for the executor’s computational stage.

Return type:

bosk.stages.Stage

__pipeline :bosk.pipeline.BasePipeline#
__slot_handler :BaseSlotHandler#
__block_executor :bosk.executor.block.BaseBlockExecutor#
__stage :bosk.stages.Stage#
__inputs :None | FrozenSet[str]#
__outputs :None | FrozenSet[str]#
_prepare_slot_handler(slot_handler)#

The default slot handler can be changed in a child class by overriding this method.

Parameters:

slot_handler (Optional[BaseSlotHandler]) – Slot handler passed by user or None.

Returns:

Slot handler.

_prepare_block_executor(block_executor)#

The default block executor can be changed in a child class by overriding this method.

Parameters:

block_executor (Optional[bosk.executor.block.BaseBlockExecutor]) – Slot handler passed by user or None.

Returns:

Block executor.

__process_inputs_outputs(inputs, outputs)#
Parameters:

  • inputs (Optional[Sequence[str]]) –

  • outputs (Optional[Sequence[str]]) –

Return type:

None

_map_input_names_to_slots(input_values)#

Method to translate dictionary, passed in __call__(), to dictionary that is useful for evaluation. :param input_values: Input data, passed to the __call__() method.

Returns:

Remapped input data.

Parameters:

input_values (Mapping[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) –

Return type:

Dict[bosk.block.base.BlockInputSlot, bosk.data.BaseData]

_check_input_values(input_values)#

Method to check up the input values, passed in __call__(). :raises AssertionError: If the inputs are specified and the :arg:`input_values`

do not correspond to them.

Parameters:

input_values (Mapping[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) –

Return type:

None

_is_slot_required(slot)#

Method that determines if the slot is required during the computational graph execution. Added for additional debugging (and polymorphism) features and to make the code shorter.

Parameters:

slot (bosk.block.base.BlockInputSlot) – The computational block’s slot to check.

Return type:

bool

_execute_block(block, block_input_mapping)#

Method that executes the block. Added for additional debugging (and polymorphism) features and to make the code shorter.

Parameters:

  • block (bosk.block.base.BaseBlock) – The computational block to execute.

  • block_input_mapping (bosk.executor.block.InputSlotToDataMapping) – The data for the block execution.

Return type:

bosk.block.base.BlockOutputData

__call__(input_values)#

Executes the pipeline given BaseData or just NumPy arrays and returns results dictionary.

Parameters:

input_values (Mapping[str, Union[bosk.data.BaseData, numpy.ndarray]]) – Input data.

Returns:

Calculated output data.

Return type:

ExecutionResult

abstract execute(input_values)#

Executes the pipeline given BaseData inputs and return BaseData output values.

Parameters:

input_values (Mapping[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) – Input data.

Returns:

Calculated output data dictionary that maps output names to the data.

Return type:

Dict[str, bosk.data.BaseData]
